content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
No new structures have been successfully constructed by the agent. Repeated recovery updates targeted a Lab Supply System at position (0.5, 2.5) intended to deliver Automation Science Packs for research, but all attempts to place or craft a Lab failed because the lab item was not available in inventory and the required sub-ingredients were missing. Although pre‐existing furnace structures (one at Position(x=5.0, y=5.0) used for additional iron plate smelting and another at Position(x=-27.0, y=-60.0) employed for copper plate production) were accessed for resource processing, no new structures were created—the current scan still reports no entities on the map.

ERROR TIPS
• API Parameter Errors for get_entities
 – When calling get_entities, do not pass unsupported keyword arguments (such as “radius”) or extra positional parameters. Verify the function signature to use the appropriate parameter style.
  
• Invalid Iteration on Returned Entities
 – Before iterating over results (for example, using a list comprehension on existing labs), ensure the returned value isn’t None. Use a fallback (like an empty list) to prevent “NoneType” iteration errors.
  
• Lab Placement Failures
 – Confirm that the Lab item is available in the inventory before attempting placement at a target position. Also, check that the target tile is unobstructed to allow successful placement.
  
• Crafting Resource Shortages
 – Prior to initiating Lab crafting, prevalidate that all sub-ingredients (for example, iron-plates needed for iron-gear-wheels and copper-plates required for copper-cables/electronic-circuits) are available in sufficient quantities. Ensure that the complete production chain (including furnaces or crafting machines) is in place to supply these materials.
  
• General Resource and API Validation
 – Always double-check resource inventories and API usage patterns before executing critical placement or crafting commands to avoid cascading errors stemming from missing ingredients or incorrect function calls.
